text: The 1980 WDF Europe Cup was the 2nd edition of the WDF Europe Cup darts tournament, organised by the World Darts Federation. It was held in Copenhagen, Denmark from October 3 to 4. ==Entered Teams== 11 national teams entered into the event. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Nr. !! Country !! Men's Selection |- |align=right| 1 || || Luc Marreel, Andre Declerq, Andre Desmit, Lucien Deduytsche |- |align=right| 2 || || Jorgen Rasmussen, Kaj Mortensen, Jan Larsen, Kim Jensen |- |align=right| 3 || || Eric Bristow, Cliff Lazarenko, John Lowe, Doug McCarthy |- |align=right| 4 || || Kajp Sundsten, Matti Heinonen, Jorma Karumaa, Seppo Jaakola |- |align=right| 5 || || Peter Hummel, Jimmy Hughes, Tammo Schendermein, Alfred Gibson |- |align=right| 6 || || Mohamed Bakali, Freddie Duarte, Leslie Ward, John Neale |- |align=right| 7 || || John Buckley, Eugene McDermott, Jim McQuillan, Seamus O'Brien |- |align=right| 8 || || Roy Dunlop, Billy Mateer, Anthony McCaugherthy, Dessie Noade |- |align=right| 9 || || Peter Lee, Herman Jongman, Jilles Vermaat, Peter Smith |- |align=right| 10 || || George Nicoll, Eric MacLean, Jocky Wilson, Rab Smith |- |align=right| 11 || || Stefan Lord, Bjørn Enqvist, Nils- Magnus Ericksson, Becke Johansson |- |align=right| 12 || || John Assiratti, Alan Evans, Tony Ridler, Leighton Rees |} ==References== Category:Darts tournaments
title: 1980 WDF Europe Cup
